title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.3 RESPONSE

description.narrative: Output 3.3. Children and their families are accessing quality multi-sectoral protection services including birth registration by 2025, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2025, children in Uganda especially the most vulnerable and those affected by humanitarian situations are protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation, including harmful practices, and realize their right to legal identity

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3. Children and their families are accessing quality multi-sectoral protection services including birth registration by2025

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen child protection systems to prevent and respond to violence against children and harmful practices. Children in contact with the law continued to benefit from child-friendly justice services and procedures, while progress was made in improving the capacity of the social service workforce, judiciary and law enforcement on the provision of quality multi-sectoral child protection critical services in line with international standards. Birth registration services have progressively been scaled up in 27 out of 33 UNICEF focus districts. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2022
